titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

bioghist.p: The Strickler is allied to the Houston family through the marriage of Susan Strickler to Samuel Nelson Houston. Jacob Strickler, a member of the Pennsylvania State Legislature between 1797 and 1800, lived in Lancaster County. He married Sarah Wilson, and their daughter Susan married Samuel Nelson Houston. The son of Sarah and Samuel N. Houston was Henry Howard Houston, father of Eleanor Houston Smith.

scopecontent.p: The Strickler Family Papers contain notes on family history and genealogy; correspondence, photographs, and clippings regarding the Strickler graveyard and farm; and letters from W. H. Strickler in Kansas to his cousin, Henry Howard Houston.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
